questions.question: What is the time complexity of binary search?
questions.explanation: Binary search has a time complexity of O(log n) because it halves the search space at each step.

questions.question: Which data structure uses LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle?
questions.explanation: A Stack follows the LIFO principle where the last element added is the first one to be removed.

questions.question: What does the acronym 'HTTP' stand for?
questions.explanation: 'HTTP' stands for HyperText Transfer Protocol, which is the foundation of data communication on the World Wide Web.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid debugging technique?
questions.explanation: Random Testing is not a systematic debugging technique and may not effectively pinpoint issues in code.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a 'for' loop in programming?
options: To iterate over a sequence of elements
questions.correctAnswer: To iterate over a sequence of elements
questions.explanation: A 'for' loop is used to iterate over a sequence of elements and perform repetitive tasks efficiently.

questions.question: Which sorting algorithm has the best average-case time complexity?
questions.explanation: Merge Sort has an average-case time complexity of O(n log n) making it efficient for sorting large datasets.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using a hash table for data storage?
questions.explanation: Hash tables offer constant-time lookup which allows for efficient retrieval of data based on keys.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a syntax error in programming?
questions.explanation: Forgetting to close a parenthesis leads to a syntax error as the code structure is not properly formed.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a 'linked list' in data structures?
questions.explanation: A linked list allows for dynamic memory allocation and flexible insertion/deletion of elements in a data structure.

questions.question: What is the role of a 'constructor' in object-oriented programming?
questions.explanation: A constructor is a special method used to initialize objects when they are created in object-oriented programming.
